exercise.title: Router Config - 2
exercise.name: router_config_2
exercise.description: Router configuration exercise meant to refresh your understanding of how to read router configurations. Similar in difficulty to the first router config exercise.
exercise.tutorial:
Given four separate router configurations, construct a network map connecting all the devices to the internet. The map must include AS (autonomous system), hostnames, interface labels and IP addresses.

On the share in your defensive workstation, open the Networking > Router_Config_2 folder to access the router config files. Analyze them and answer the questions below. For the network map, take a screenshot or save an image of your map and upload in the last question.

question.text: What routing protocol is being used?
Using the router configuration for R1, what are the usable IPs that exist on interface Ethernet0/2? Separate the IPs by a comma.
Using the router configuration for R1, subnet "ip dhcp pool VLAN10", what is the IP address range? Answer format: 1.1.1.0 - 1.1.1.63
Using the router configuration for R1, subnet "ip dhcp pool VLAN10", what is the CIDR?
Using the router configuration for R1, subnet "ip dhcp pool VLAN10", what is the first host address?
Using the router configuration for R1, subnet "ip dhcp pool VLAN10", what is the last host address?
Using the router configuration for R1, subnet "ip dhcp pool VLAN10", what is the subnet address?
Using the router configuration for R1, subnet "ip dhcp pool VLAN10", what is the broadcast address?
Using the router configuration for R1, subnet "ip dhcp pool VLAN10", how many usable host addresses are there?
Using the router configuration for R4, is network address translation taking place?
Which router is directly connected to the internet service provider? i.e. R1, R2, R3, R4, etc.
Take a screenshot or save an image of your network map and upload below.
